name: Era Evolution Paths - Phase 3
description: Tracking how concepts, frameworks, and technologies evolved across five technological eras

evolution_pattern_types.description: Concept present and continuously evolving across all eras

evolution_path.on-prem: Rolodex cards, manual tracking, desktop databases
evolution_path.cloud-native: Salesforce, cloud CRM platforms, mobile access
evolution_path.gen-ai: AI-powered insights, predictive analytics, automated personalization
evolution_path.agentic-ai: Autonomous relationship management, AI agents handling customer interactions
evolution_path.bci: Neural customer empathy interfaces, thought-driven engagement

evolution_pattern_types.description: Concept only relevant in later eras

evolution_path.gen-ai: EMERGENT - critical skill for working with LLMs

evolution_pattern_types.description: Concept relevant in early eras but fades or transforms completely

evolution_path.on-prem: DOMINANT - primary method for data input
evolution_path.cloud-native: DECLINING - web forms and APIs reduce need
evolution_path.gen-ai: RARE - OCR and voice interfaces handle most input
evolution_path.agentic-ai: OBSOLETE - agents handle all data capture
evolution_path.bci: N/A - neural interfaces bypass data entry entirely

evolution_path.on-prem: PARADIGM: Waterfall, compiled languages, manual testing
evolution_path.cloud-native: PARADIGM: Agile, microservices, CI/CD, infrastructure as code
evolution_path.gen-ai: PARADIGM: AI-assisted coding, natural language specs
evolution_path.agentic-ai: PARADIGM: AI agents write and maintain code, humans provide intent
evolution_path.bci: PARADIGM: Thought-to-code, neural software architecture visualization

on-prem.description: Manual human deliberation, committee decisions, hierarchical approval chains

cloud-native.description: Data-driven decisions with BI tools, dashboards, A/B testing
cloud-native.key_tools: Tableau, Power BI, analytics platforms, automated reporting
cloud-native.cognitive_load: Medium - systems aggregate data, humans analyze
cloud-native.transition_challenges: Data silos, integration complexity, skill gaps

gen-ai.description: AI-assisted analysis, scenario modeling, predictive recommendations
gen-ai.key_tools: GPT-powered analysis, predictive analytics, AI copilots
gen-ai.cognitive_load: Low-Medium - AI handles analysis, humans provide judgment
gen-ai.bias_management: AI bias detection, but risk of algorithmic bias amplification
gen-ai.transition_challenges: Trust in AI recommendations, explainability, ethical concerns

agentic-ai.description: Autonomous agent decision-making within human-defined parameters
agentic-ai.key_tools: Multi-agent systems, automated decision engines, continuous optimization
agentic-ai.cognitive_load: Low - agents handle tactical decisions, humans set strategy
agentic-ai.bias_management: Agents can recognize and compensate for human biases, but introduce new risks
agentic-ai.transition_challenges: Maintaining human agency, accountability ambiguity, systemic risk

bci.description: Thought-speed decisions, neural voting, collective consciousness decision-making
bci.key_tools: Neural interfaces, brain-to-brain communication, augmented cognition
bci.bias_management: Neural bias detection and correction, but deep privacy concerns
bci.transition_challenges: Cognitive sovereignty, mental privacy, identity preservation

key_transitions.transition_mechanism: Data accessibility explosion - cloud platforms democratize access to information
key_transitions.resistance_factors: Organizational inertia, data governance concerns, skill requirements
key_transitions.catalyst_technologies: Cloud computing, SaaS BI tools, mobile devices

key_transitions.transition_mechanism: AI can process and synthesize information faster than humans
key_transitions.resistance_factors: Trust in AI, explainability demands, fear of job displacement
key_transitions.catalyst_technologies: Large language models, GPT-4, AI APIs

key_transitions.transition_mechanism: Shift from AI assistance to AI autonomy within constraints
key_transitions.resistance_factors: Accountability concerns, loss of human agency, systemic risks

key_transitions.transition_mechanism: Direct neural augmentation bypasses external interfaces
key_transitions.resistance_factors: Safety, ethics, cognitive sovereignty, identity preservation

evolution.on-prem: Phone support, manual ticketing, knowledge base documents, hold times
evolution.cloud-native: Zendesk, help desk platforms, omnichannel support, self-service portals
evolution.gen-ai: AI chatbots, sentiment analysis, automated ticket routing, knowledge retrieval
evolution.agentic-ai: Autonomous support agents, proactive issue resolution, predictive support
evolution.bci: Empathic neural interfaces, thought-driven problem resolution, emotional state sensing

evolution.on-prem: Monoliths, three-tier architecture, tightly coupled systems, manual deployment
evolution.cloud-native: Microservices, containers, service mesh, API-first, DevOps automation
evolution.gen-ai: AI-enhanced architectures, intelligent middleware, adaptive systems
evolution.agentic-ai: Self-organizing systems, agent-based architectures, autonomous scaling
evolution.bci: Neural-interfaced systems, thought-reactive architectures, consciousness-aware computing

cross_era_themes.description: Compression of time between problem recognition and action
cross_era_themes.trend: Weeks -> Days -> Hours -> Minutes -> Seconds -> Thought-speed

cross_era_themes.description: Where mental effort is required changes across eras
cross_era_themes.progression: All on humans -> Data gathering automated -> Analysis automated -> Decision automated -> Cognition augmented

cross_era_themes.description: Who/what has authority to make decisions evolves
cross_era_themes.progression: Humans only -> Humans with tools -> Humans + AI assistants -> AI agents + Human oversight -> Human-AI fusion

extraction_methodology.step_1: Identify all exemplars with era_mapping spanning multiple eras
extraction_methodology.step_2: For each concept, extract era-specific implementations from cross_era_evolution field
extraction_methodology.step_3: Group concepts by transformation type (continuous, emergent, obsolete, paradigm shift)
extraction_methodology.step_4: Identify transition points and catalysts between eras
extraction_methodology.step_5: Calculate evolution velocities (how quickly concepts transformed)

query_patterns.query: How did CRM evolve from on-prem to agentic AI?
query_patterns.method: Filter exemplars where name contains 'CRM', examine era_mapping and cross_era_evolution

query_patterns.query: What concepts emerged in the Gen AI era?
query_patterns.method: Find exemplars where era_mapping starts with 'gen-ai' (no earlier eras)

query_patterns.query: What became obsolete by the Agentic era?
query_patterns.method: Find exemplars present in on-prem/cloud-native but absent from agentic-ai
Filter exemplars where era_mapping includes all 5 eras

query_patterns.query: What are the key transition challenges from Gen AI to Agentic AI?
query_patterns.method: Aggregate transition_challenges from exemplars spanning both eras

visualization_suggestions: Sankey diagram showing concept flow between eras
Timeline showing emergence and obsolescence patterns
Heatmap of concept relevance across eras
Transition waterfall showing era adoption speeds
usage_note: This file defines era evolution structure. Actual evolution paths extracted from Master 4500 records with cross_era_evolution and era_mapping fields.
